pages.text: Frying pans are for stir fry, stone griddle is one of the cheapest pans. Due to its poor heat conductivity, it is significantly slower than metal ones.
Metal pans can be made of copper and iron. Frying pans should be put on heat source, like $(l:intro/stove)stoves$(/l) or $(l:worldgen/fumarole)fumarole vent$(/l).

Frying pans are similar with stew pots except no fluid interaction. Buttons on the left side controls its start and restone control, redstone default off. Bowl and $(l:intro/spices)spice$(/l) should be put in the right side slots, the get finished dishes.
Before start cooking, there should be $(l:resting/oil)oil$(/l) and enough bowl in the pan. Oil is automatically taken from nearby gravy boats.
Without liquid, stir fry dishes does not have any sort of concentration, instead, There would be a dish about each two ingredients (rounded up).
With redstone control on, if pan is not working and redstong signal provided. It would keep trying to start working. This is useful for automation.
